name: X-Force 2015 C64 [FREE]
description:
At long last the slick C64 shoot 'em up X-FORCE from Richard Bayliss has been given a proper commercial release by Psytronik! This download bundle features a version of the game with awesome soundtracks by FeekZoid along with a special version with trance soundtracks by Richard Bayliss. As a special bonus the download also includes the Crazy Hack version of the game by Vinny Mainolfi. This version contains a plethora of cheats, hacks and modifications made to the game.

X-FORCE is also available from Psytronik Software in the following formats:-

C64 tape - presented in a clear cassette case with full-colour glossy inlay.

Budget C64 disk - presented in a glossy disk sleeve with full colour label.

Premium+ C64 disk - presented in a clear case with full-colour double-sided inlay.


** X-FORCE STORY **

It has been discovered the planet Darx is rich in minerals that Earth needs to use to construct a shield to protect our planet from a possible alien invasion. You are sent on a mission to the planet Darx to extract the minerals we desperately need for our planetary defence shield.

Darx was not an uninhabited planet however. Your ship is detected on approach and an alien mothership dispatches forces that capture your vessel. You must use your wits, cunning and reflexes to avoid the aliens and escape from the 16 underground sectors of the planet Darx. You must avoid laser gates on the way and grab any floating pods that can enhance your firepower.

** X-FORCE FEATURES **

• Three full versions of X-FORCE!

• 16 levels of blasting action!

• Slick in-game graphics!

• Includes Crazy Hack version of the game!

** X-FORCE CREDITS **

Richard Bayliss - Programming / Music / SFX

FeekZoid - Additional Music

Saul Cross - Graphics

Carl Mason - Loading Screen

Vinny Mainolfi - Crazy Hack

Dirk Schmitt - NTSC Fix

Martin Piper - Disk / Tape Turbo Loader system

Jason 'Kenz' Mackenzie - Game Packaging

Oliver Frey - Inlay Artwork

** SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS **

X-FORCE is a game for the Commodore 64. You can play the game in a C64 emulator (we recommend VICE) or you can port the game onto real C64 hardware if you have the resources to do so. The download file features the .d64 (disk version), .tap (tape version) and .prg (c64 program files).
